      • getFiles

                                    java.lang.String extension,
                                    boolean recursive)
        Deprecated. use HFileUtils.getFiles
        Get all files in a directory
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to get the files from
        extension - The extension of the files to get, without the dot so e.g. "gpml"
        recursive - Whether to include subdirectories or not
        Returns:
        A list of files with given extension present in the given directory

      • expandGlob

        public static java.util.List<java.io.File> expandGlob(java.lang.String glob,
                                      java.io.File baseDir)
        Deprecated. use HFileUtils.
        Expand a unix GLOB, such as '~' or '*.java' into a list of files. only files or directories that actually exist are returned. If there are no matches, returns an empty list.

        TODO only tested on unix, not likely to work well on Windows.

        Parameters:
        glob - the glob pattern
        baseDir - if the glob is relative, it will be taken relative to this Directory. If it is absolute, this parameter has no effect. If baseDir is null, the current directory will be used.
        Returns:
        list of files or directories, or an empty list if there are no matches.

      • expandGlob

        public static java.util.List<java.io.File> expandGlob(java.lang.String glob)
        Deprecated. use HFileUtils.
        expand glob relative to current directory

      • makeApplicationDir

        public static java.io.File makeApplicationDir(java.lang.String name)
        Deprecated. use HFileUtils.
        Get suitable directory to store application data in a cross-platform way. On *NIX: $HOME On Windows: %APPDATA% Then create a subdirectiory in that based on name. Create it if it doesn't yet exist. Use a staring period on *NIX, not on windows.

      • getApplicationDir

        public static java.io.File getApplicationDir()
        Deprecated. use HFileUtils.
        Get suitable directory to store application data in a cross-platform way. On *NIX: $HOME On Windows: %APPDATA%

      • safeMachineName

        public static java.lang.String safeMachineName()
        Deprecated. use HFileUtils.
        The standard java way of getting the machine name, using InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName(), could lead to a reverse dns lookup with all kinds of failure modes.

        This method simply wraps that call in a try/catch handler, and returns a reasonable default otherwise

      • safeMachineName

        public static java.lang.String safeMachineName(java.lang.String defaultMachineName)
        Deprecated. use HFileUtils.
        Same, but specify the default if no machine name was specified.
